agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides patient and family centered comprehensive care for hemophilia, thrombosis, sickle cell disease, and other bleeding and clotting disorders.
site_name: INDIANA HEMOPHILIA AND THROMBOSIS CENTER - ASCENSION ST. VINCENT EVANSVILLE
service_name: SICKLE CELL OUTREACH CLINIC - VANDERBURGH COUNTY
service_description: Provides routine sickle cell care, care coordination and social support, preventative screenings, labs and vaccinations, and comprehensive appointments with social work and career counselors. Offers virtual and in-person appointments.
site_details: Call or email for information, referrals, or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Must have Sickle Cell Disease, Sickle Cell Trait, or other hemoglobin disease or trait

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a community meal and clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides clothing in various sizes to those in need.
site_details: Walk in. -- Use door facing Columbia Street.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Daviess, Dubois, Gibson, Knox, Perry, Pike, Posey, Spencer, Vanderburgh, or Warrick County -- Currently and chronically homeless (staying in an emergency homeless shelter, living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_name: AREA 16 LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN - INDIANA LEGAL SERVICES
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Gibson, Perry, Posey, Spencer, and Warrick County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Gibson, Perry, Posey, Spencer, or Warrick County

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM

service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Vanderburgh County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Vanderburgh County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during office hours or complete online application. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

agency_name: VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA OF OHIO AND INDIANA
agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering counseling, rehabilitation, job placement, and residential services.
service_description: Provides residential substance use treatment and support services for pregnant women recovering from substance use disorder including opioid use disorder. The women (and up to two pre-school aged children) may stay during their pregnancy and after the birth for a maximum of 75 days. Clients receive a clinical assessment, treatment, pre- and post-natal support, and parenting and life-skills training. Medical detoxification is not provided. Ongoing home-based services are provided up to one year after discharge. Programming may differ for women who have an open case with the Indiana Department of Child Services (DCS).
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_details: Call the office for availability and complete a phone assessment; if voicemail is reached, leave contact information. -OR- Submit an assessment online.

site_schedule.name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Recovery Center: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Recovery Center: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Recovery Center: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Pregnant women with or without children -OR- women with two or less children, age 5 or younger -- Age 18 or older -- Struggling with a substance addiction, including opioid use -- Eligible for Medicaid or Active DCS Case

site_name: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT - SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF INDIANA - EVANSVILLE DIVISION
address_1: 101 Northwest Martin Luther King Junior Boulevard
service_description: Hears both civil and criminal federal cases, including bankruptcy cases, for select southern Indiana counties. Information about court procedures, jury selection, and obtaining court records is available by phone.
site_details:
?Call for information.

Offenders assigned to probation, parole. or supervised released by the federal courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit university offering many education opportunities including certifications, associate and baccalaureate degree programs, and cultural opportunities.
service_description: Offers language instruction for beginner to advanced level English-speakers. Students learn to speak, read, and write English. Registration is required.
site_details: Call, text, or email to register for classes.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Beginning to advanced English-speakers
Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency providing services for individuals with developmental disabilities.
site_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - DISTRICT 7
service_name: HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED MEDICAID WAIVERS / CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICES - DISTRICT 7
service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)

site_schedule.name: Domestic Violence Intervention Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Men's Classes: Tues 4pm and 6:30pm; Wed 9am and 1:30pm -- Women's Classes: Wed 6pm; Thurs 9am

site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides financial assistance for pets needing urgent or emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for pet medical needs and provides outdoor shelters (dogs or cats) and other items pet owner may need to properly care for dog or cat.
site_details: Visit www.helpinghandsanimal.org/application to apply.
site_eligibility: Living in Vanderburgh County -- Pet needing urgent or emergency care -- Pet owners must meet one of the following criteria: Low income --Elderly pet owner -- Disabled pet owner -- Veteran pet owner

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of Evansville in Vanderburg County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers

site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - EVANSVILLE DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office patrols the Indiana East-West Toll Road that runs across northern Indiana.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Gibson, Knox, Pike, Posey, Vanderburgh, and Warrick County

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that collects donated food and distributes to charities feeding the hungry at no charge.
site_name: TRI-STATE FOOD BANK - MOBILE FOOD PANTRY LOCATOR
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Visit agency's website to access monthly list by date. Time will be noted whether CST or EST. -- Drive through for service. -- Provide name, number of household members, and county of residence.

site_eligibility: 501 (c)(3) organizations located in Daviess, Dubois, Gibson, Perry, Pike, Posey, Spencer, Vanderburgh, or Warrick County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that operates various support services for homeless individuals, including shelter services, work transportation, hot meal, and transitional housing.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for men in need. Supportive services are also offered.
site_details: Walk in. -- First come first serve
site_eligibility: Open; able to pass sobriety test

service_description: Provides emergency, overnight shelter for women without children. Additional support services are also offered to those staying at this facility.

agency_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - BUFFALO TRACE COUNCIL
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a strong focus on the outdoors and survival skills that aims to support young people in their physical, mental, and spiritual development so that they may play constructive roles in society.
site_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - BUFFALO TRACE COUNCIL
service_description: Promotes development and leadership for boys through group skill-building activities, outdoor recreation, and community service projects.
site_details: Call for more information.

agency_desc: A public higher education institution, located on a beautiful 1,400-acre campus in Evansville, Indiana, USI offers programs through the College of Liberal Arts, Romain College of Business, College of Nursing and Health Professions, and the Pott College of Science, Engineering, and Education.
service_description: Provides low-cost general dental care to people in need during specific times each Spring and Fall semester. Services performed by dental hygiene students under the supervision of faculty. Each appointment take approximately 3-4 hours.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit website for information. Allow up to 3-4 hours for an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Dental Care
site_schedule.schedule: Fall Semester (Sept-Dec): Mon and Wed 8am and 1pm; Mon-Thurs 5:30pm -- Spring Semester (Jan-April): Mon-Thurs 8am, 1pm, and 5:30pm

site_eligibility: Open
High school diploma or high school equivalency test -- Successful application

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
address_1: 1 Northwest Martin Luther King Junior Boulevard
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Vanderburgh County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
